author: nc1234
content:
Regarding block proposer constructing payload attestation https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/master/specs/gloas/validator.md#constructing-payload_attestations 
> The slot of the parent block is exactly one slot before the proposing slot.
Does this mean if proposer at slot n is not building on n - 1 block (could be n - 1 slot has no beacon block), proposer should include 0 payload attestation in its block body right?

author: potuz
content: Yes. It's useless to include payload attestations for previous blocks and they aren't penalized/rewarded anyway
